title: Man Utd turn back on Gareth Bale transfer swoop after doubts over injury record

Manchester United will not be offering Gareth Bale an escape route from Real Madrid - after deciding the Welshman is more X-ray Factor than X-Factor.

As Sunday Mirror Sport revealed in June, the Red Devils were given the chance to take Bale on a season-long loan after Zinedine Zidane told the winger he was no longer wanted at the Bernabau.

United were in the market for a world-class signing to make a statement of intent.

But Old Trafford bosses decided against taking up Real's offer to bring the 30-year-old back to the Premier League for the season and agreeing to pay his £500,000-a-week wages due to fears that Bale is injury prone.

(Image: SIPA USA/PA Images)

United now employ private investigators as well as scouts to look into the background of every potential signing.

And Bale's fitness record – and the fact that he is nicknamed 'The Golfer' by his Bernabeu team-mates – meant the deal went cold.

According to high-level sources at United, they are unlikely to revisit the possibility to sign the former Tottenham and Southampton star unless he agrees to a pay-as-you-play deal.

(Image: Getty Images)

Instead, United are already working on a deal to bring Borussia Dortmund's brilliant teenage winger Jadon Sancho back to the Premier League next summer.

Sancho, 19, left Manchester City two seasons ago to seek first-team football in the Bundesliga.

He is already a regular international and United will not baulk at paying £100million-plus for a player who is seen as the future of English football.

United were stung when they smashed their wage structure to land Alexis Sanchez from Arsenal 18 months ago.

They are still paying most of the Chilean's £500,000-a-week wages despite offloading him on loan to Inter Milan.

Sanchez has now been sidelined until the New Year by an ankle injury picked up on international duty.

United believe the 30-year-old will be sent back to Old Trafford at the end of the season and they will be stuck with a player that is no longer wanted by Ole Gunnar Solskjaer.
description: EXCLUSIVE: Man Utd were close to signing Gareth Bale on a season loan in the summer but bulked at the wages
